properties.headline: High Surf Warning issued January 24 at 4:05PM HST until January 26 at 6:00PM HST by NWS Honolulu HI
properties.description:
...HIGH SURF WARNING FOR NORTH AND WEST FACING SHORES OF NIIHAU
KAUAI OAHU MOLOKAI AND NORTH FACING SHORES OF MAUI...

.A long-period northwest swell will steadily build through the day
Saturday and peak late Saturday afternoon into Saturday night.
This swell is expected to gradually decrease Sunday and into early
next week.

* WHAT...Surf rising to 24 to 34 feet Saturday and lowering to 20
to 28 feet Sunday along north and west facing shores Niihau and
Kauai, and north facing shores of Oahu, Molokai and Maui. Surf
rising to 15 to 25 feet Saturday and lowering to 12 to 20 feet
Sunday along west facing shores of Oahu and Molokai..

* WHERE...North and west facing shores of Niihau, Kauai, Oahu,
Molokai and north facing shores of Maui.

* WHEN...From 6 AM Saturday to 6 PM HST Sunday.

* IMPACTS...High. Expect ocean water occasionally sweeping across
portions of beaches, very strong breaking waves, and strong
longshore and rip currents. Breaking waves may occasionally
impact harbors making navigating the harbor channel dangerous.
properties.instruction:
Large, breaking surf, significant shorebreak, and dangerous
currents make entering the water very hazardous.

Anyone entering the water could face significant injury or death.

NWSheadline: HIGH SURF WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM SATURDAY TO 6 PM HST SUNDAY
